definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: Each Olympic Games, is the Greek festival of people .
sentences.chinese: 每一屆奧林匹克運動會，都是全希臘人民的節日。

sentences.english: People are doing their Christmas shopping.
sentences.chinese: 人們正在購買節日用品。

sentences.english: The Double Nine Festival is the festival for the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 重陽節是老年人的節日。

sentences.english: The folk festival is also native happy days of male - female loving seasons.
sentences.chinese: 民俗節日也是民間男歡女愛的時節。

sentences.english: Many Vancouver neighbourhoods have their own local festivals.
sentences.chinese: 溫哥華很多街區有自己的節日。

sentences.english: In the holiday between the relatives and friends mutually congratulates , the gift, the expression is mutually friendly.
sentences.chinese: 節日裏親友之間相互祝賀，互贈禮品，表示友好。

sentences.english: Soon the house smelled fresh and piney , and the day took on a festive air.
sentences.chinese: 很快，家裏聞起來很清新，帶着節日的氣息。

sentences.english: There’s no need to add to the corniness of the holiday by throwing in a wedding proposal.
sentences.chinese: 沒必要再在這個節日搞什麼求婚之類的過時東西了。

sentences.english: Duanwu Festival is originated in China, and was initially a day to prevent illness.
sentences.chinese: 端午節起源於中國，起初是人們以祛病防疫的節日。

sentences.english: I like to use this time, also, to simplify my life.
sentences.chinese: 我同時希望利用這次節日去簡化的我生活。

sentences.english: Independence Day is one of America's  principal legal holiday.
sentences.chinese: 獨立日是美國主要法定節日之一。

sentences.english: Shangsi Festival on March 3rd lunar calendar is a traditional Chinese folk festival.
sentences.chinese: 農曆三月三上巳節是中國傳統的民間節日。

sentences.english: Mar 2016 Here She Comes, Royal Festival Hall, London (performance in collaboration with Marvin Gaye Chetwynd.
sentences.chinese: 表演，皇家節日大廳，倫敦，英國。

sentences.english: It has become a non-religious holiday.
sentences.chinese: 成了一個非宗教的節日。

sentences.english: This is a major Hindu festival honouring Mother Lakshmi – the goddess of wealth.
sentences.chinese: 這是印度的一個主要節日，是崇敬財富女神拉克希米。

sentences.english: It became a major shopping day in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 2009年，該節日演變成重要的網購節。

definition: to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
